title: Habif Health and Wellness Center - Students
description: We support the education and development of our students by promoting their health and well-being through the highest quality comprehensive care.
cleaned_text: Compassionate and Inclusive Care We, like our colleagues in the CDI, remain committed to our efforts to advocate for an inclusive and supportive environment for our transgender and gender-expansive students at Habif and throughout their student experience. We understand that many of the students we serve are impacted by actions that aim to restrict, diminish, make invisible, or force the erasure of their lived experience and histories. We also recognize that these decisions disproportionately impact students from limited income backgrounds and students of color. Our work will always be to elevate voices, center experiences, provide care and resources, and advocate for an inclusive experience at WashU for transgender, gender-expansive, and minoritized students. Please reach out to us for support as well as utilize [resources](https://students.wustl.edu/wp-content/uploads/2023/05/Trans-Resources.pdf) available for yourself or others [Online booking](https://studenthealth.wustl.edu/) is available for many types of appointments, including same day and urgent appointments for both medical and mental health concerns. If you are unable to book your appointment online, we are still here! Please call 314-935-6666 and listen to the prompts to be connected to a nurse or mental health coordinator and please leave a message if you reach the voicemail, as they will promptly return your call. If you need an appointment after hours, [TimelyCare](https://nam10.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Ftimely.md%2Fschools%2Findex.html%3Fschool%3Dwustl%26&data=05%7C01%7Catnip%40wustl.edu%7C8e5632c2fb5b45ab309a08da7e3a6839%7C4ccca3b571cd4e6d974b4d9beb96c6d6%7C0%7C0%7C637961086573034737%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=ANGb5fBNK9u6tBiviU2LwizWdk%2F%2BCqlT94srxmEgfYU%3D&reserved=0) is available for mental health and medical visits.
